questions.question: 1.What is the primary function of Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) in materials science?

answers.c: To provide high-resolution imaging and analysis of sample surfaces and microstructures

questions.question: 2.Which SEM imaging mode utilizes elastically scattered high-energy electrons to provide compositional contrast?
3.In Backscattered Electron Imaging (BSE), what causes certain areas of the image to appear brighter?
4.What is the advantage of Through-Lens Detection (TLD) in SEM?

answers.b: It enhances detection efficiency and allows for simultaneous detection of SE, BSE, and transmitted electrons.
answers.c: It detects X-rays emitted from the sample
answers.d: It provides information solely on crystallographic orientation.

explanations.b: Explanation 2 It enhances detection efficiency and allows for simultaneous detection of SE, BSE, and transmitted electrons.

questions.question: 5.How does Energy-Dispersive X-ray Spectroscopy (EDS) contribute to SEM analysis?

answers.a: By detecting the magnetic properties of the sample
answers.b: By generating maps that show the distribution of different elements across the sample surface
answers.c: By capturing high-resolution images of surface topography
answers.d: By determining the grain size of polycrystalline materials

explanations.b: Explanation b. By generating maps that show the distribution of different elements across the sample surface

questions.question: 6.What does SEM stand for in the context of materials science?
